Issues.Title: Documentation issue about using tabs in hero elements.
Issues.Body:
This is about **the Docs**. ### Overview of the problem Usage of tabs as suggested in the full height hero documentation is incorrect. This is about the Bulma **Docs** I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description In the documentation about full-height heroes, linked [here](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/hero/#fullheight-hero-in-3-parts), the code given for using tabs isn't the one suggested in the actual tabs documentation. The essence of the issue lies in the fact that tabs are supposed to just have a \
    element inside it for proper styling. The container element in the hero documentation should be a parent of the `.tabs` node, and not the other way around. Since it was the other way around, it was not possible to use `.is-centered` or `.is-right` on the tabs. ### Steps to Reproduce ```
    • Overview
    • Modifiers
    • Grid
    • Elements
    • Components
    • Layout
    ``` Add a `.is-centered` to the `.tabs` element. ### Expected behavior The tabs should be centered. ### Actual behavior The tabs were not centered.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Documentation issue about using tabs in hero elements." (#2562)

Issues.Title: Support for CSS Grid
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **new feature**.

### Proposed solution

This is a solution for the long standing problem of page layouts in Bulma. I have implemented an intuitive wrapper around the **CSS Grid** to accomplish this.

### Examples

Below are a few examples from the test pages for the Bulma docs that I have created.

#### Column Sizes
![Column Sizes GIF](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61598156-930d8a80-abd6-11e9-8759-15a2ec2a4184.gif)

#### Child Positioning
![Positioning Child GIF](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61598216-5beba900-abd7-11e9-8233-2f4fb31bbd3e.gif)

#### Child Sizes
![Resize Child GIF](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61598233-a8cf7f80-abd7-11e9-999a-33da706ab6fb.gif)

#### Nested Grids
![Nested Grids PNG](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61598264-2dba9900-abd8-11e9-8415-7a86ca18feb8.png)

#### Gap
![Gap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22060392/61598292-7e31f680-abd8-11e9-9155-aa4c72f7d143.gif)

All of these changes **and more** are located on the docs page of the merging branch.

For those of you who do not have access to the docs page I have set up a [fiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/james_wasson/benraucv/).


### Tradeoffs

There are a couple of drawbacks for this pull request:
- It adds about ~4000 lines to the CSS file (~145KB minified)
- Much of the functionality has already been implemented via **Bulma Tiles**
  - Do note that this interface is simpler to navigate than **Bulma Tiles**

### Discussion

**How to solve the increased file size?**
- Remove breakpoints for column counts
- Reduce the number of supported "nested grid children"
- Reduce the supported column/row counts
  - I don't recommend this because it reduces functionality a lot
- Remove `is-inverse-left` and `is-inverse-top` functionality

**Possible Additions:**
- Add `min-max` function via CSS variables
- Add gap sizes via CSS variables

**Questions:**
- What other functionality would you like to see?
- Which features do you think are most important?

### Testing Done

Yes. Please review the docs site to see the testing.

### Changelog updated?

Yes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Support for CSS Grid" (#2567)

Issues.Title: Container height
Issues.Body:
Hi there,

I've just been looking at you [Container documentation](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/container/).  
You have classes for **width**, such as `.is-widescreen`, `.is-fullhd` but you don't have any for **height**.

A comman thing to want to do it to postion a `<div>` in the center of the screen.  
I have made [a little CodePen example](https://codepen.io/luketobrien/pen/agrYKM) with a centered `<div>`, but I have had to add extra CSS rule to do that:

``` css
  height: 100vh;
  ...
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
```

Do you think you can add some classes for the height?  
Perhaps `is-full-height` or `is-flex`, `is-centred`?

> Note I used [Css Tricks](https://css-tricks.com/centering-css-complete-guide/)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Container height" (#2560)

### Description

I added a horizontal form inside a modal with a specific column size. Starting in 769px screen width, the form fields specifically with a short label the input element spans the available space.
Now, when I add other fields with a longer label, they get different input width sizes.

### Steps to Reproduce
[this is the working demo](https://jsfiddle.net/bawvs8kx/)

### Expected behavior

What I would like to achieve is for the fields to have the same input widths regardless of the label length.

### Actual behavior

Please see the working demo above. As what you can see, the E-mail label is short and its input spans the whole available space and produces not uniform form fields inside the modal.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Horizontal form fields not the same width inside modal" (#2551)

The large hero on desktop shrinks to such a small size on mobile that the image is useless. A full height hero is too large. There's no in between.
